name: Creamed Spinach
author: USA WEEKEND columnist Jean Carper
summary: Creamed spinach, made with the frozen chopped variety, perfectly complements the roast, and it can be made up to two days ahead.
ingredients: 4 (10 ounce) boxes boxes frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
directions: Combine milk, spinach liquid and garlic in a 1-quart microwave-safe measuring cup or small bowl covered with a saucer, and microwave (or heat slowly in a medium saucepan) until very hot and steamy
Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes to soften garlic
Melt butter in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat
Add hot milk mixture all at once, then whisk until smooth
Stir in spinach; cook until sauce is thick and bubbly and spinach is tender but still green, about 5 minutes
Stir in cheese, nutmeg, and a generous sprinkling of salt and pepper
